name: sads
tagline: R package for fitting species abundance distributions
body:
## Installation

Available on [CRAN](http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sads). To install and load current release version in R:

```r
install.packages(sads)
load(sads)
```

### Devel version

You can install developer version from GitHub with:

```r
library(devtools)
install_github('sads', 'piklprado', 'dev')
```

## Motivation
The distribution of abundances of species is one of the basic patterns of ecological communities. The empirical distributions of abundances (SADs) or their ranks (RADs) are modelled through probability distributions. Hence, the maximum likelihood method can be used to fit and compare such models. 

## Features
 - Classic SAD models: logseries, lognormal, broken-stick, ... 
 - Classic rank-abundance modelos: geometric, zipf, zipf-mandelbrodt, ...
 - Tools for quick diagnostic and comparison of models; 
 - Tools to simulate Poisson and negative binomial samples from abundances in communities.


## More info
 - User guide:
```r
vignette(topic="sads_intro", package="sads")
```
 - [Research project](http://ecologia.ib.usp.br/let/doku.php?id=engl:projects:sads) at our [Lab wiki](http://ecologia.ib.usp.br/let)
 - Report bugs and issues [here](https://github.com/piklprado/sads/issues).
